concept.title: Audience Segments in Reports
concept.shortdesc: Segments help you understand how each segment set up in the campaign is performing.

conbody.p: If you need to learn more about setting up segments in campaigns, see .
Applying a segment to a report helps you understand how each segment set up in the campaign is performing. The segment filter is available in these reports:

Target can calculate the segments that have a different winning experience from the control experience, and with statistical confidence. When you click Detect Interesting Segments under the segments list in the report, two asterisks (**) will show next to each interesting segment in the list. This helps you identify and focus on the segments that are different from your overall traffic.
The Interesting indicator is shown when:

ol.li:
The following conditions are met:
The winning experience for the segment is different from the winning experience for the All segment.
The confidence interval that two experiments have different conversion rates is greater than N (N=95%).
Example
You have 3 experiences: expA, expB, expC.
Assume the winning experience is expB (5% of impressions leads to conversion), but a big part of visitors from segmentN leads to conversion for experience expA. (For example, 23% of visitors with request parameter referredFrom='google.com' bought product A.) The Interesting indicator should display for this segment.
Experiments are:
E1 [segmentN[expA] impressions/segmentN[expA] conversions]
E2 [segmentN[expB] impressions/segmentN[expB] conversions]

ul.li: The winning experience for the segmentN is the same as the winning experience for the All segment.
The confidence interval that two experiments have different conversion rates is greater than N (N=95%).

li.p: You have three experiences: expA, expB, expC.

Assume the winning experience is expB (5% of impressions leads to conversion), but a larger (in %) part of visitors from segmentN leads to conversion for experience expB. (For example, 23% of visitors with request parameter referredFrom='google.com' bought productB.) The Interesting indicator should display for this segment.

ul.li: E1 [segmentN[expB] impressions/segmentN[expB] conversions], E2[all[expB] impressions/all[expB] conversions]

conbody.p: To select one of these segment filters, select the radio button next o the segment, then click Apply.

The report data updates to show data only for people in the selected segment. You can toggle between segments to view the differences between segments, and between each segment and the overall population.
Click Push Winner next to an experience name when the segment filter is applied to create a new campaign targeted to that specific segment. The new campaign contains this winning experience.

All of the success metrics and segment filters are copied to the new campaign. You can edit the segments and success metrics before launching the new targeted campaign. After you approve this new campaign and deactivate the original test, the winning content displays to everyone from the selected segment. If different experiences win for each segment, push each winner. The appropriate targeting is enabled to ensure that members of each segment see the winning content. Remember to deactivate the original test.
